descriptionSet.description: In this image two men with beards, turbans and wearing elaborately styled kurtas (shirt) can be seen playing a game of shatranj (an ancient form of chess). In the background the silhouette of a mosque and other architectural elements can be seen.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

titleSet.title: Textile label Showing Two Men Playing Chess

hra:item.hra:value: description-en: In this image two men with beards, turbans and wearing elaborately styled kurtas (shirt) can be seen playing a game of shatranj (an ancient form of chess). In the background the silhouette of a mosque and other architectural elements can be seen. (gs/sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Shatranj became popular as a game in Persia and travelled there from India in the early centuries of the Christian era. It is an old form of chess that eventually led to the modern form of chess as we know it now. (sp)
